urn:contentItem:4MWY-3YS0-TX2W-W26M-00000-00Briefing.com: Hourly In Play (R) - 23:00 ET2007-01-24T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:29:47ZLexisNexisBriefing.com: Hourly In Play (R) - 23:00 ET

Hourly In Play (R)

Updated: 24-Jan-07 23:00 ET

20:06

WGOV Woodward Governor announces quarterly dividend increase to $0.11 from $0.10 (40.99 -0.86)

19:33

RKT Rock-Tenn announces the acquisition of the minority interest of GSD Packaging, LLC; co sees transaction as accretive to earnings (28.68 +0.18)

Co announced that it has acquired the remaining 40% minority interest in GSD Packaging, LLC that it did not own for $32 mln, giving RKT sole ownership of the co. Co says they expect this acquisition to be immediately accretive to earnings.

18:50

EPD Enterprise Prdcts announces launch of Duncan Energy Partners L.P. IPO (29.40 -0.40) -Update-

Co announced that Duncan Energy Partners L.P. has commenced its initial public offering of common units which is expected to price during the week of January 29, 2007. Duncan Energy Partners is offering 13,000,000 common units (or 14,950,000 common units if the underwriters exercise their option to purchase additional common units in full) at a price between $19.00 and $21.00 per common unit. When issued, the common units will be listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "DEP".

18:22

SCHW Charles Schwab authorizes additional stock repurchase of up to an additional $500 mln (18.91 +0.07)

17:02

CTT Competitive Technologies agrees to cancel hearing in Nano Case; bond to be posted (2.17 -0.06)

Co announces that it reached an agreement today with John Nano relating to a prejudgment remedy hearing scheduled to proceed today before a Federal Court Magistrate. Pursuant to agreement, the hearing was cancelled and CTT will post a bond. According to the judge's order issued today, "the parties have agreed, and upon their agreement the court has ordered, that a bond in the amount of $2.5 mln to serve as security shall be posted by a reputable insurance co by the close of business on January 26, 2007. The court further notes that this measure saves substantial litigation costs to both sides of this lawsuit, as well as conserves valuable judicial resources, which can be better spent assisting the parties with a possible resolution of this case in its entirety." The court has agreed to assist the parties in expedited settlement discussions.

17:01

WRAPX Market Wrap

Stocks rallied Wednesday as renewed optimism on the earnings front, especially from some notable tech names, sparked a wave of buying interest that closed all three major averages sharply higher. The Dow finished in record territory, the S&P 500 hit a fresh six-year high and the Nasdaq closed up 1.4%, extending its year-to-date leading advance to more than 2%. More...

17:01

IPCS IPCS Inc announces departure of Chief Operating Officer (52.60 +0.68)

Co announces that Alan Morse, its chief operating officer, has left the co by mutual agreement. The co will immediately begin its search for a new chief operating officer. Until a replacement is found, Tim Yager, President and CEO, will assume the duties previously performed by Morse.

17:00

Coast Financial Holdings (CFHI) announces engagement of financial advisor to review its strategic options (8.04 -1.26)

CFHI announced today that the company's Board of Directors has engaged Sandler O'Neill & Partners, L.P. to advise on the financial aspects of the Company's review of its strategic options. Chairman Toomey said the engagement of Sandler O'Neil was to help the Board evaluate the strategic alternatives for the company while acting in the best interest of its shareholders. He further indicated that all options would be on the table, including remaining independent.

17:00

EVVV EV3 announces US FDA approval of Protege RX Carotid Stent (17.72 +0.01)

Co announced U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval of the Protege RX Carotid Stent. This stent, when used in conjunction with the ev3 embolic protection device, is indicated for the treatment of carotid artery disease in patients who are at high-risk for adverse events from carotid artery surgery. ev3's SpideRX Embolic Protection Device was previously FDA cleared for carotid use in February 2006.

16:59

SPA Sparton announces Navy contract (8.26 +0.02)

Co announces it was awarded a contract for the manufacture of sonobuoys for the US Navy. The contract is valued at $13.8 mln.

16:53

ACUS Acusphere issues 2007 update/guidance (2.70 +0.10)

Co says "our cash position at the end of 2006 was $59.7 million (unaudited). This funding level provides Acusphere with the ability to stay focused on delivering the RAMP-2 results and continue with the manufacturing qualification progress in anticipation of the NDA submission. We begin 2007 expecting that our operating activities will require some $10-$12 million in cash per quarter, with additional quarterly expenditures of approximately $2 million for payments against asset-backed installment debt and dividends on preferred stock. In addition, we are scheduled to make payments totaling $8 million in the second quarter of 2007 as the final remaining non-contingent payments against previously announced intellectual property agreements. We anticipate that our spending on internal development of pipeline product opportunities will be relatively modest in 2007, reflecting their early stage of development. Our spending on the additional clinical programs will also be modest because together they involve only about 50 new patients. Based on this guidance, our current cash can meet our projected needs through 2007."

16:48

TW 21st Century Insurance: American International Group proposes to acquire publicly held shares of 21st Century Insurance for $19.75/share (16.59 +0.25)

American International Group (AIG) announces that it has submitted a letter to the board of directors of TW proposing to acquire the outstanding 38.1% publicly held shares of TW for $19.75 per share in cash. AIG and its subsidiaries own approximately 61.9% of the outstanding shares of TW. The aggregate cash consideration payable would be approximately $690 mln. Following the transaction, TW would become a wholly owned subsidiary of AIG. (Stock is halted)

16:45

BRCM Broadcom regains compliance with Nasdaq requirements (30.69 +1.23) -Update-

16:44

SUF Sulphco: Gunnerman says will continue to seek injunctive and declaratory relief (3.09 +0.25) -Update-

Dr. Rudolph Gunnerman, the former CEO and a director of SUF responds to the counterclaim filed by certain members of the Board of Directors: "...The accusations in the counterclaim filed today by certain members of SUF's Board of Directors are without merit. I intend to vigorously defend myself against these baseless allegations and I will continue to seek relief from the court in my effort to protect the rights of all shareholders.."

16:39

NADX National Dentex announces Wayne Coll will succeed Richard Becker as CFO (16.61 -0.39)

16:35

EPAY Bottomline Tech beats on top and bottom line (10.47 +0.23)

Reports Q2 (Dec) earnings of $0.10 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.08 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.02; revenues rose 13.8% year/year to $29.7 mln vs the $27 mln consensus. "As a result of our second quarter operating performance and our pipeline, we expect a strong second half of our fiscal year."

16:33

MTSC MTS Systems beats by $0.08 (40.04 +0.43)

Reports Q1 (Dec) earnings of $0.54 per share, $0.08 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.46; revenues rose 7.9% year/year to $99.1 mln vs the $94.6 mln consensus.

16:31

SMTL Semitool beats on top and bottom line; issues downside Q2 guidance (12.01 -0.23)

Reports Q1 (Dec) earnings of $0.18 per share, $0.06 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.12; revenues rose 23.0% year/year to $68 mln vs the $65.2 mln consensus. Net income benefited from improved revenue and gross margin performance, a gain of $648,000 from the sale of a building, and the renewal of the federal research and development tax credit. Co issues downside guidance for Q2, sees EPS of $0.02-0.04 vs. $0.18 consensus; sees Q2 revs of $55-57 vs. $70.83 mln consensus.

16:31

SOLD Housevalues names Barry Allen as Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President of Operations (5.24 +0.08)

Allen was CFO for Move.com, Cendant Corporation's online real estate business, from 1999 to 2001, where he was focused on building the Move.com business, scaling its operations, and unlocking shareholder value. Jacqueline L. Davidson, who served as interim Chief Financial Officer since the search process was announced this summer, continues as Vice President of Finance on Allen's team. Separately, the company announced the elimination of the Chief Operating Officer role formerly held by Clayton Lewis, who has left the company to pursue other interests.

16:30

CY Cypress Semi announces $300 mln stock repurchase program (17.67 +0.55) -Update-

16:26

VARI Varian beats on top and bottom line (46.75 +0.15)

Reports Q1 (Dec) GAAP earnings of $0.49 per share, $0.02 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.47; revenues rose 11.3% year/year to $217.9 mln vs the $208.6 mln consensus. "Demand in most markets continues to be robust and our newer products are gaining traction. The strength and breadth of our product lines and of our sales and support organization position us to deliver another record year."

16:24

LSI LSI Logic reports $0.01 above consensus; guides Q1 EPS in-line, revs below consensus (10.48 +0.49)

Reports Q4 (Dec) earnings of $0.14 per share, $0.01 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.13; revenues rose 6.2% year/year to $523.7 mln vs the $516.4 mln consensus. Co issues guidance for Q1, sees EPS of $0.08-0.10 vs. $0.10 consensus; sees Q1 revs of $460-480 mln vs. $489.71 mln consensus.

16:24

HWAY Healthways announces it has rec'd full accreditation for depression and oncology programs, renews accreditation for 7 others (43.30 -0.27)

Co announces it has received full, 3-yr renewal of accreditation status by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its diabetes, congestive heart failure, coronary artery disease, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, asthma, renal and impact conditions programs. Additionally, N.C.Q.A has granted full, 3-yr accreditation to co's depression and oncology programs.

16:21

STTS STATS ChipPAC beats on top and bottom line; issues mixed Q1 guidance (7.99 +0.22)

Reports Q4 (Dec) earnings of $0.17 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.05 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.12; revenues rose 16.4% year/year to $416 mln vs the $407.5 mln consensus. Co issues mixed guidance for Q1, sees EPS of $0.06-0.10 vs. $0.11 consensus; sees Q1 revs of $374-391 vs. $388.10 mln consensus. "As for the first quarter of 2007, our current customer forecasts reflect the seasonal slowdown in the semiconductor industry and their general caution."

16:20

SYMC Symantec beats by a penny, reaffirms; announces $1 bln buyback (17.48 +0.07)

Reports Q3 (Dec) earnings of $0.26 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.01 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.25; revenues rose 5.7% year/year to $1.32 bln vs the $1.31 bln consensus. Co reaffirms Q4 guidance, sees EPS of $0.18-0.20 vs. $0.20 consensus; sees Q4 revs of $1.25-1.28 bln vs. $1.27 bln consensus. Co reaffirms FY07 guidance, sees EPS of $0.92-0.95 vs. $0.95 consensus; sees FY07 revs of $5.13-5.16 bln vs. $5.14 bln consensus. Co separately announces a $1 bln buyback.

16:18

CBST Cubist Pharma reports $0.01 below consensus (18.21 +0.60)

Reports Q4 (Dec) earnings of $0.10 per share, including stock-based compensation, $0.01 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.11; revenues rose 53.2% year/year to $56.5 mln (note co preannounced revs).

16:16

SHFL Shuffle Master announces exclusive distribution agreement with Lightning Poker (26.88 +0.47)

Co announces it has entered into an exclusive distribution agreement with Lightning Poker. Under the terms of the agreement, Shuffle Master will be responsible for promoting, marketing, distributing and servicing the Lightning Poker Gaming System worldwide. Additionally, Shuffle Master will have the option to make an equity investment in Lightning Poker, as well as to acquire an additional interest in the co if a Lightning Poker initial public offering is conducted.

16:16

YSI U-Store-It sees 2007 FFO per diluted share in range of $1.11-$1.21 vs $1.17 consensus (21.05 +0.04)

16:15

ASYT Asyst names Michael Sicuro as Chief Financial Officer (6.57 +0.28)

Co announces that it has named Michael Sicuro as senior vice president and CFO. Richard Janney, who has served as acting CFO since Sept. 2006, will remain with the co for a period of time to assure a smooth transition.

16:15

ARBA Ariba reports $0.04 above consensus (7.92 +0.16)

Reports Q1 (Dec) earnings of $0.13 per share, $0.04 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.09; revenues rose 1.2% year/year to $77.2 mln vs the $75.9 mln consensus.

16:14

QCOM Qualcomm beats by a penny, revs slightly light; guides Q1 in-line, reaffirms FY07 guidance (38.62 +0.49)

Reports Q1 (Dec) earnings of $0.43 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.01 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.42; revenues rose 16.0% year/year to $2.02 bln vs the $2.07 bln consensus. Co issues in-line guidance for Q2, sees EPS of $0.42-0.44 vs. $0.44 consensus; sees Q2 revs of $2.0-2.1 bln vs. $2.1 bln consensus. Co reaffirms FY07 guidance of EPS of $1.72-1.77 vs. $1.78 consensus; revs of $8.1-8.6 bln vs. $8.56 bln consensus.

16:13

CEPH Cephalon comments on study of its leukemia treatment; encouraged by the oncology community's continued interest in the potential of Trisenox (73.84 +0.42)

Co comments on the announcement today by the National Cancer Institute and one of its Cooperative Clinical Trials Groups, the Cancer and Leukemia Group B, regarding event-free and overall survival results from a clinical trial using Trisenox injection in newly diagnosed patients with acute promyelocytic leukemia. Co says fter reviewing the results from more than 500 patients in the study, a data safety monitoring board notified the investigators and the N.C.I of the positive results and the findings are being released based on their impact on the treatment of A.P.L. A complete scientific presentation of these study results is planned for the annual meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology in June 2007. "The results of this study showing a survival benefit associated with the use of TRISENOX in patients with APL are an important development for physicians and patients, as demonstrated by the urgency to disseminate the results to clinicians in an expedited manner. We are encouraged by the oncology community's continued interest in the potential of Trisenox, and these study results reinforce Cephalon's commitment to build a fully integrated oncology business."

16:06

VARI Varian authorizes new $100 mln stock repurchase program (46.75 +0.15)

16:05

SYMC Symantec announces a $1 bln share repurchase program (17.48 +0.07)

16:05

ENPT En Pointe Tech signs multi-yr agreement with west coast manufacturer (5.99 +0.07)

Co announces it has signed a multi-year agreement to provide continuous 24x7 service desk, end user support, hardware and software maintenance, install/move/add/change, and managed rollout services for a major West Coast manufacturer with operating facilities throughout the western United States. Under the terms of the agreement, co will assume responsibility for managing all aspects and associated service levels of the service desk.

16:03

AIT Applied Industrial announces planned retirement of President and COO (24.32 +0.49)

Co announces that Bill Purser, President and Chief Operating Officer, has chosen to retire effective December 31, 2007. "In anticipation of Bill's decision, and in collaboration with the board of directors, we have been engaged in a rigorous succession planning process over the last 2 years. As a result of that process, the board has elected Ben Mondics to the position of Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer, effective February 1, 2007..."

16:01

OXPS OptionsXpress Announces Acquisition of XpressTrade (22.10 +0.07)

Co announces it has completed the acquisition of XpressTrade for approx $37 mln. Management will discuss the transaction in more detail on the upcoming fourth quarter call (1/31).

16:00

UNM UNUMProvident announces sale of GENEX subsidiary (20.41 +0.19)

Co announces it has entered into a definitive agreement for the sale of its wholly owned subsidiary, GENEX Services, a leading workers compensation and medical cost containment services provider, to Trident, a fund managed by Stone Point Capital, a global private equity firm. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed, although the co said it will result in a small net gain.

15:55

CY Cypress Semi: Chapman Capital reiterates demand for Cypress Semiconductor reorganization (17.60 +0.48)

Chapman Capital announces "it had been contacted by the Chairman of the Board of Cypress Semiconductor in response to their late Dec 2006 reorganization proposal. However, when implored by Chapman Capital Managing Member, Robert Chapman, Jr., to cite any and all points of disagreement with the claims and assumptions made within Chapman Capital's Dec 28, 2006 letter to Cypress's Board, Chairman Eric Benhamou failed to convey any message of substance rebutting even one of the detailed, pro-split off arguments made therein. Chapman Capital feels compelled to reiterate several core components of its reorganization proposal ahead of Cypress's January 25, 2007 earnings conference call:... Chapman Capital emphasizes that it is the responsibility of Cypress's Board to find solutions to complex tax and other problems that may thwart shareholder value creation of an enormous magnitude, such as Chapman Capital's proposed SunPower split-off/LBO reorganization. A Board that allows a 1% shareholding CEO to exert seemingly full control over Cypress should not expect to remain in its position for an extended period. 2) A Premium Bid Over Market Value Is Not Requisite to an "Adequate" Merger Proposal: Any semi-sophisticated investor realizes that the public market may value excessively the target of an announced or rumored change of control transaction..... "

15:48

LORL Loral wins $51 mln in action against Cablevision Subsidiary (43.74 +0.94) -Update-

Co announces it has won a jury verdict in the Supreme Court for the State of New York in its contract action against Rainbow DBS Holdings, Inc., a subsidiary of Cablevision Systems Corporation (CVC). The unanimous verdict will result in a judgment of approximately $51 million to Loral.

15:35

USU USEC Inc. names J. Tracy Mey as Chief Accounting Officer (13.15 0.41)

Co has named J. Tracy Mey as the Co's controller and chief accounting officer. Mey will continue to report to John Barpoulis, senior vice president, chief financial officer and treasurer.

15:35

Earnings Calendar

Today after the close look for the following companies to report: ACXM, ACF, ASIA, CLDN, CBST, EGLT, EBAY, FFIV, FIC, ISIL, KOMG, LSI, MTH, MIPS (revs only), MGI, NFLX, NETL, NVLS, PRXL, PREC, PLXS, PLCM, QCOM, RMBS (revs only), RYL, SWFT, SYMC, TALX, TER, TXT, TRID (revs only), VARI, VAR, and WSTL. Tomorrow before the open look for the following companies to report: ALK, ACV, T, AVT, BLL, BAX, BZH, BDX, BJS, BMY, CAH, CY, DHR, FCS, F, IMCL, IONA, LM, LMT, LYO, HZO, MESA, NE, NOK, NUE, OXY, BTU, DGX, RESP, SU, SPWR, STJ, TSM, TDY, USAK, and ZOLL.

15:29

Conferences and Shareholder/Analyst Meetings of Interest

Events of interest tomorrow, January 25, include: SMGAnnual Shareholder Meeting; ASH Annual Meeting of Shareholders; ADY, AOB, BRLC, CACH, CHKE at Brean Murray One on One Winter Small-Cap Consumer Conf; EXR, AMB, DRE, FR at Bank of America Securities 2007 Out of the Box REIT Summit; F 4th Quarter Financial Results - Fixed Income Conf Call; SCSC Second Quarter 2007 Conf Call.

15:28

TEVA Teva Pharma files patent infringement complaints regarding Sertraline Hydrochloride (34.71 -0.25)

Co announces that it has filed infringement complaints against a number of finished dose companies which manufacture sertraline hydrochloride, AB rated to Zoloft, and their active pharmaceutical ingredient suppliers. Teva filed the complaints in the United States District Courts of New Jersey, Delaware, Southern District New York, and Maryland for infringement of its U.S. Patents Nos. 6,600,073 (expiring June 2020), 6,500,987 (expiring Nov 2019), 6,495,721 (expiring May 2020) and 6,897,340 (expiring April 2023), covering processes of making sertraline hydrochloride.

15:23

BONDX Bond Watch: Itching for a Rally

The market scratched for better levels but there was little to support prices. The session wasted away the early part of the session while sniffing around for drivers, with the 5-&10-yrs basically running neck & neck ahead of the 2-yr auction results. Results were a mixed bag of very good to not-so-hot, but managed to drag some unwinds in, pulling the curve trade into lesser inversion. The market will be primed for some action on tomorrow's data, potentially giving a hair-trigger reaction to less-than-worthy prints with the housing reports through Fri being the likeliest powder-keggers. The curve was able to work into the least inverted territory on the week, with the 2-10-yr yield spread heading out at -12. The dollar was mixed on the session with the euro down at 1.2958 & the yen stronger at 120.9450. The pound felt the brunt of the action with a knock down to 1.9669 as it was dented by lowered expectations toward rate hikes in the UK & carry trade unwinds. Spot gold recovered from selling pressure to 648.20 (+1.50) while crude oil is up at 55.29 (+0.25). Initial jobless claims, existing home sales & a $13B 5-yr notes auction are all on tap for tomorrow. The 10-yr yield is near unchanged at 4.806%. For more bond commentary click here.

15:19

UTX United Tech: Pratt & Whitney wins $200 mln V2500 deal from Spirit Airline (66.65 0.51)

Pratt & Whitney, a UTX co, was awarded business worth more than $200 mln as the co's share of an order from Spirit Airlines for International Aero Engines V2500 engines. The order, for installed and spare engines to power 30 new Airbus A319 aircraft, is backed by a long-term V2500Select service agreement.

15:18

NXY Nexen pushes higher intraday towards its 2006 high of 63.65 (63.64 +2.27) -Technical-

15:18

TECHX Market View: S&P 500 meets Fib target (1438.14 +10.15) -Update- -Technical-

The S&P 500 dropped roughly 2% off its Dec high to a support zone marked by the 50% retrace (late Nov-Dec run) and its 50 sma/ema. Solid run off this low established a new high of 1435 before a choppy consolidation over the previous four days again stalled near the 50% retrace of the 1403-1435 rally (click for daily chart). Technical traders often use pull backs such as the Dec/Jan slide and the recent 1435-1420 decline to gauge potential for the next move higher based on Fibonacci extension targets. Interestingly, the 127.2% extension of the 1431-1403 and 1435-1420 pull backs both come into play at 1439 which was met today (session high 1439.18). By itself this in not a reason to exit the market but it does suggest watching for signs of a consolidation/pullback near this target zone.

15:14

ATI Allegheny Tech pushes higher intraday to probe its December peak of 98.72 (99.25 +4.87) -Update- -Technical-

15:05

LORL Loral: Space Systems/Loral wins contract to build direct broadcast satellite for EchoStar (43.20 +0.40)

Co announces it has been awarded a contract to manufacture a new direct broadcast satellite for EchoStar Orbital Corporation II. EchoStar XIV (DISH) will provide expanded services and flexibility for DISH Network's 13 mln direct-to-home television subscribers.

14:25

TECHX Casino Index -DJUSCA- edges slightly above last wk/previous 52-wk high at 754.33-- session high 754.82 (754.29 +11.02) -Update- -Technical-

WMS +5.4%, WYNN +2.7%, LVS +3.1%, ASCA +1%, SHFL +1.8%, BYD +1%, MGM +2.5%, FNET +2.3%.

14:02

DMC Document Security Systems announces partnership with Spain's indra systems S.A. to produce passport certificates for the Panama Canal authority (11.80 +0.02)

14:00

TER Teradyne accelerates ''Poison Pill'' expiration and declassifies Board (15.55 -0.34)

Co annoounces that its Board of Directors has voted to amend the co's Shareholders Rights Agreement to accelerate the expiration of the Rights Plan from Nov 27, 2010 to Feb 8, 2007, at which time the Rights Plan will terminate. The Board also voted to amend the co's bylaws to declassify the Board, so that all directors are elected annually, a change that will take effect at the co's 2008 Annual Shareholders Meeting.

13:11

CYBX Cyberonics sends letter to stockholders; urges stockholders to reelect Board's nominees (20.50 -0.63) -Update-

13:03

PALM Palm: Alltel Wireless now offering Palm Treo 700p smartphone (13.95 +0.13)

13:00

INGN Introgen reports that INGN 241 in combination with Avastin results in complete tumor regression (5.41 +0.38)

Co announces the publication of data in Molecular Therapy, the journal of the American Society of Gene Therapy, highlighting the results of a preclinical study with INGN 241 in combination with Avastin (DNA). Synergistic activity resulting in a curative therapeutic effect was seen in the treatment of lung cancer following the combination of the two agents. In contrast, treatment with Avastin alone demonstrated only minor tumor regression and no animals were cured of their cancer. "The outcome of this study is encouraging and for the first time we are able to show that lung tumors treated with a combination of INGN 241 plus Avastin produced complete inhibitory activity," The study shows that the combination of INGN 241 and Avastin is very effective and blocks tumor angiogenesis -- the formation of new blood vessels within a tumor -- that is essential to support tumor growth beyond a minimum size. The results indicate that tumors completely regressed within the first four weeks of treatment and that no additional growth was observed after cessation of therapy.

DALRQ CEO Gerald Grinstein testifies at Senate Committee hearing; notes standalone co will provide superior value (1.17 0.11)

Gerald Grinstein, CEO of DALRQ, appeared before the U.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation to provide testimony to the full committee about the state of the airline industry and the potential impact of airline mergers and industry consolidation. In his testimony, Grinstein also addressed the unsolicited takeover proposal made by US Airways (LLC). As previously stated, Delta's Board of Directors rejected the initial proposal made by US Airways on Nov. 15, 2006 and concluded that the company's standalone Plan of Reorganization will provide creditors with superior value as well as a faster recovery and much greater certainty of execution. Grinstein said that a primary reason for Congress to examine the competitive impact of the LLC proposal deal is that if the merger were to go forward, it would trigger broad industry consolidation. He said, "if this anticompetitive proposed merger gains approval despite its substantial adverse impacts on competition, consumers, communities and employees, virtually any other airline merger would likely pass regulatory muster. In our view, the likely outcome of follow-on consolidation would be to leave the combined Delta and US Airways as the weakest carrier, with little West Coast and Asian presence and a staggering debt load."

The co says it's pre-clinical safety, pharmacology and toxicology studies have demonstrated favorable results to date. YHOO Yahoo! beats by $0.03; guides slightly below consensus for Q1 & FY07 (26.96 -0.46)

Reports Q4 (Dec) earnings of $0.16 per share, excluding non-recurring items and including stock based compenastion expense, $0.03 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.13; revenues rose 15.0% year/year to $1.23 bln vs the $1.22 bln consensus. Co issues downside guidance for Q1, sees Q1 revs of $1.12-1.23 bln vs. $1.25 bln consensus. Co issues downside guidance for FY07, sees FY07 revs of $4.95-5.45 bln vs. $5.46 bln consensus.

16:30

AMD Advanced Micro misses on bottom line, guides Q1 revs below consensus (17.51 -0.02)

Reports Q4 (Dec) loss of $0.04 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.12 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.08; revenues rose 31.2% year/year to $1.77 bln (includes ATYT) vs the $1.74 bln consensus; revs ex-ATYT were $1.37 bln, in-line with guidance. Q4 gross margin was 40% (vs 47.3% Street expectations) compared to 52% in 3Q06 and 57% in 4Q05. The decrease from the prior qtr was due largely to significantly lower server processor average selling prices and the inclusion of the former ATYT operations. Co issues downside guidance for Q1, sees Q1 revs of $1.6-1.7 bln vs. $1.82 bln consensus. (Stock is halted.)

16:30

ADBE Adobe Systems names new Chief Financial Officer (37.52 -0.31)

Co announces that Mark Garrett has been named executive vice president and CFO. Most recently, Garrett served as senior vice president and chief financial officer of EMC Software Group within EMC Corp (EMC).

16:29

QI Qimonda reports Q1 EPS of Euro 0.52 vs Euro 0.48 in 1Q06; revs rose 73% YoY to Euro 1.17 bln (16.05 +0.16)

Co reports Q1 EPS of Euro 0.52 vs Euro 0.48 in 1Q06; revs rose 73% YoY to Euro 1.17 bln. Qimonda expects its bit production to grow between 8-12% in 2Q07. The co expects this bit growth to be based on improved productivity as a result of the continued conversion of capacities to 90nm technology and below. Qimonda also expects to maintain its share of bit-shipments to non-PC applications significantly above 50% in the next quarter. For the full year, Qimonda expects bit demand to be driven by the continued strong growth for DRAM in consumer and communication applications and also by the introduction of the Windows Vista operating system. The co expects the market measured in bits to grow between 55-65%, in line with most market analyst expectations like Gartner and iSuppli for calendar year 2007. Qimonda intends to increase bit production in line with overall market growth.

16:22

SUNW Sun Microsystems: KKR Private Equity Investors to invest in Sun through $700 mln of senior convertible notes (5.66 -0.09) -Update-

Co announces a $700 mln private placement transaction with KKR Private Equity Investors. The investment will be in the form of $350 mln of convertible senior notes due in 2012, and $350 mln of convertible senior notes due in 2014. A nominee of KKR will be presented for appointment to the Sun Microsystems Board of Directors upon or shortly following the close of this transaction.

16:19

AMD Advanced Micro halted ahead of earnings (17.51 -0.02) -Update-

16:19

HOKU HOKU Scientific reports $0.03 below consensus; guides Q3 rev in-line with consensus (6.14 0.34)

Reports Q3 (Dec) loss of $0.06 per share, $0.03 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of ($0.03); revenues fell 34.7% year/year to $1.1 mln vs the $1.2 mln consensus. Co issues in-line guidance for Q4, sees Q4 revs of $1.0-1.2 mln vs. $1.15 mln consensus. Based upon projections, the co expects to report a loss to break even results for the fourth quarter ending March 31, 2007.

16:13

SUPX Supertex misses by $0.03, guides for Q4 (36.93 +0.32)

Reports Q3 (Dec) earnings of $0.44 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.03 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.47; revenues rose 21.0% year/year to $24.1 mln vs the $27.1 mln consensus. Co sees flat to modest sequential sales growth and in Q4 from Q3's $24.1 mln vs $27.8 mln consensus.

16:13

LOOK Looksmart's Net Nanny acquired by Content Watch (4.73 -0.14)

Co announces that ContentWatch acquires all the assets of Net Nanny from LOOK. No other terms disclosed.

16:13

CTXS Citrix Systems beats on top and bottom line; issues Q1 and FY07 guidance (32.27 +1.16)

Reports Q4 (Dec) earnings of $0.39 per share, $0.01 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.38; revenues rose 19.3% year/year to $321 mln vs the $311.4 mln consensus. CTXS reports license update revs $109 mln vs $107 mln street expectation. Co issues in line EPS guidance for Q1, sees EPS of $0.34-0.35 vs. $0.35 consensus; sees Q1 revs of $298-308 mln vs. $297.95 mln consensus. Co issues in line EPS guidance for FY07, sees EPS of $1.51-1.54 vs. $1.52 consensus; sees FY07 revs of $1.29-1.31 bln vs. $1.28 bln consensus... Because the options review is ongoing, the co has not yet determined if it will need to record any non-cash adjustments to compensation expense related to prior stock option grants, making today's results preliminary. Specifically, the co does not know whether any such non-cash compensation charges would affect the preliminary financial results for the fourth quarter ended December 31, 2006 or the full year 2006 being announced today, or would be deemed material and require the company to restate previously issued financial statements or would require an adjustment to the retained earnings balance on the company's balance sheet. If any such charges are required, Citrix will also need to determine the impact of this matter on its system of internal controls.

16:13

AIH Ablest announces receipt of going private proposal at $7.50 per share (7.00 +0.20)

Co announces that its Board of Directors had received a proposal from certain existing investors, including Charles Heist, the co's Chairman of the Board, Kurt Moore, the co's President and Chief Executive Officer, The Burton Partnership, Limited Partnership and The Burton Partnership, Limited Partnership, to acquire all of the co's publicly held common stock for $7.50 per share in cash. The co's Board of Directors has formed a Special Committee of four independent directors to review and evaluate the proposal and any strategic alternatives to the proposal that may be available to the co. The co cautions its stockholders and others considering trading in its securities that its Board of Directors has just received the proposal, and that the process of considering the proposal is only in its beginning stages.

16:10

STX Seagate Tech reports $0.07 above consensus; guides Q3 and Y07 above consensus (26.18 0.30)

Reports Q2 (Dec) earnings of $0.39 per share, $0.07 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.32; revenues rose 30.3% year/year to $3 bln vs the $2.93 bln consensus. Co issues upside guidance for Q3, sees EPS of $0.56-0.60 vs. $0.54 consensus. Co issues upside guidance for FY07, sees EPS of $1.70-1.75 vs. $1.64 consensus.

16:08

RFMD RF Micro Device beats by $0.03; guides in-line (6.88 +0.05)

Reports Q3 (Dec) earnings of $0.16 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.03 better than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.13; revenues rose 35.2% year/year to $281.1 mln vs the $273.4 mln consensus. Co issues in-line guidance for Q4, sees EPS of $0.10-0.11 vs. $0.10 consensus; sees Q4 revs of $250-260 mln vs. $255.29 mln consensus.

16:07

IPAR Inter Parfums reports record Q4 sales and raises 2006 earnings guidance (18.69 +0.37)

Co sees Q4 revs of approx $90.3 mln vs $76.44 mln consensus. At comparable foreign currency exchange rates, net sales for 2006 were up 16%. Sales for 2006 substantially exceeded mgmt's previous forecast of between $305-$306 mln. As result, 2006 net income is now expected to be in the range of $17.2-$17.5 mln, which equates to $0.84 to $0.85 vs $0.83 consensus. The co's prior 2006 net income guidance had been $16.9 mln or $0.83 per diluted share. The co plans to release operating results for the Q4 and year ended Dec 31, 2006 on or about March 7, 2007. The co indicated that it is too early to adjust its current 2007 guidance. Co reaffirms 2007 net sales of approx $365 mln vs $362.59 mln consensus and net income of $20.4 mln or $1.00 per diluted share vs $1.02 consensus. Co says that its 2007 guidance assumes the dollar remains at current levels. "Sales by our U.S. operations surged in the fourth quarter by 141% to $19.8 mln due to the September launch of the personal care products we developed and supply to Banana Republic's North American stores, as well as the existing personal care programs and new holiday programs that we have created and have been supplying to Banana Republic and Gap stores. The programs we are developing for the Gap's North American stores are scheduled for an initial launch to begin in the spring of 2007, with the rollout continuing throughout the balance of the year and into 2008..."

16:06

DELL Dell says Nasdaq grants it's request for continued listing (24.29 -0.20)

Co announces that the Nasdaq Listing Qualifications Panel has granted the co's request for continued listing on the Nasdaq Stock Market, subject to the following conditions: The co must provide Nasdaq with certain information regarding the previously announced Audit Committee investigation by March 1, 2007, and file its delinquent periodic reports, along with any required restatements of prior financial statements, by March 14, 2007. The co anticipates that it will be able to provide Nasdaq with the requested information by the March 1 deadline.

16:05

APN Applica: Harbinger Capital partners acquires Applica for $8.25 Per Share (8.24 -0.21)

Co announces that it has completed the previously announced merger transaction with affiliates of Harbinger Capital Partners under which Harbinger Capital Partners has acquired Applica. The shares of Applica common stock that Harbinger Capital Partners did not previously own were cancelled and converted into the right to receive $8.25 per share in cash, without interest.

16:04

CLZR Candela halted, ahead of earnings (11.90 -0.07)

16:03

HYSL Hyperion Solutions to acquire Decisioneering (34.42 +0.44)

Co announces it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire Decisioneering, a privately held decision analysis software and solutions co. Hyperion will operate Decisioneering as a stand-alone Hyperion business unit. Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

16:02

STX Seagate Tech halted (26.18 -0.30)

16:01

GOL Gol Intelligent Airlines reports that Gollog FY06 revs rose 60% YoY to R$ 126.1 mln (29.59 -0.62)

Co announced today that Gollog, the airline's cargo transport service, achieved 51% carried volume growth in 2006 -- an increase from 27,300 tons in 2005 to 41,200 tons last year. Gross revenue also increased last year, up 60% from R$ 78.6 mln to R$ 126.1 mln.

16:01

SYNX Synergx wins $350K award to supply communication equipment to NY City (1.66 +0.03)

urn:contentItem:4R8W-Y1W0-TX2W-W007-00000-00Briefing.com: Hourly In Play (R) - 23:00 ET2007-12-04T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:29:47ZLexisNexisBriefing.com: Hourly In Play (R) - 23:00 ET

Hourly In Play (R)

Updated: 04-Dec-07 23:00 ET

18:31

FNMFannie Mae announces initial dividend for preferred stock series R (35.18 -1.07) -Update-

The Board of Directors of Fannie Mae (FNM) declared an initial dividend of $0.2118 per share on the co's preferred stock Series R. The dividend payment for preferred stock Series R will be paid on December 31, 2007, to registered stock holders, as shown on the books of the corporation at the close of business on December 17, 2007, for the period from and including November 21, 2007, to but excluding December 31, 2007.

18:27

MRTN Marten Transport announces one mln share repurchase program for common stock (11.48 +0.67)

Co announced that its board of directors has approved a share repurchase program for the co to repurchase up to one mln shares of its common stock. This program is intended to be implemented through purchases made in either the open market or through private transactions, in accordance with Securities and Exchange Commission requirements.

18:17

VECO DMetrix hires Chief Operating Officer (15.82 -0.40)

DMetrix, announced that Lloyd J. LaComb, Jr., Ph.D. has joined DMetrix as Chief Operating Officer and a board member of the company. Dr. LaComb has most recently been Senior Vice President of Technology of Veeco Instruments (VECO), where he has worked since 1997. Prior to joining VECO, Lloyd held technical and management positions of increasing responsibility at Tencor Instruments and Prometrix, both now part of KLA-Tencor.

18:01

COGN Cognos announces early termination of HSR waiting period in connection with acquisition by IBM (57.41 +0.18)

Co announced that the Federal Trade Commission and the Antitrust Division of the United States Department of Justice have granted early termination of the mandatory waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Act (HSR) in connection with the proposed all cash acquisition of Cognos by IBM at a price of $58.00 per share.

17:40

EXAR Exar expands distribution agreement with Future Electronics (8.96 -0.08)

Co and Future Electronics announced expansion of their long standing partnership by including several key countries from Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.

17:32

IGTE iGATE offshore subsidiary signs a strategic IT partnership agreement with the Union Bank of California (8.02 -0.55)

Co announced that the Co's offshore subsidiary, iGATE Global Solutions, Ltd. ("iGS") signed a key technology services agreement with the Union Bank of California, the 25th largest bank in the US based on assets.

17:26

AFAM Almost Family announces expansion of revolving credit facility (18.67 -0.56)

Co announced that it has amended the terms of its previously existing $22.5 mln bank credit facility. The amended facility provides for: Up to $40 mln in borrowings with a maturity date of June 2010. The borrowing base formula permits borrowings of up to 3.5 times Earnings Before Interest Taxes Depreciation and Amortization.

17:15

ETC Environmental Tectonics announces resignation of auditor (2.35 -0.08)

Co announced that on November 28, 2007, Grant Thornton LLP ("Grant"), the independent registered public accounting firm for the Co, resigned. In connection with its resignation, Grant advised the Audit Committee of the Co's Board of Directors that the reason for its resignation is that information has come to Grant's attention that has led it to no longer be able to rely on management's representations and has made it unwilling to be associated with the financial statements prepared by management.

17:08

SOHUSohu.com raises Q4 revs guidance above consensus; raises Q4 EPS guidance (59.83 +1.75)

Co raises Q4 revs guidance to $55.5-57.5 mln vs $54.7 mln First Call consensus, up from $53.5-55.5 mln prior guidance; raises EPS guidance $0.36-0.38, excludes option expense, may not be comparable to $0.29 consensus. Co says, "Although TLBB is experiencing robust growth to date, Sohu anticipates the game to mature starting Q1 of 2008."

17:07

FNMFannie Mae confirms dividend cut and $7 bln preferred stock issuance (35.18 -1.07) -Update-

Co confirms that it plans to issue $7 bln of non-convertible preferred stock in one or more offerings in December. This financing will provide the co with additional capital to conservatively manage increased risk in the housing and credit markets, help meet its mission of providing affordability, liquidity and stability, and free up capital to pursue emerging growth opportunities. In light of the planned preferred stock issuance, Fannie Mae's Board of Directors, at its regularly scheduled meeting in January, intends to reduce the company's quarterly common stock dividend beginning with the first quarter of 2008 by 30% from $0.50 per share to $0.35 per share. The company said these issuances are designed to help Fannie Mae maintain a solid capital position through 2008, and believes they will strengthen Fannie Mae's ability to manage the effects of ongoing volatility in the mortgage credit markets, continue to grow its securitization activities, and pursue attractive investment opportunities. (Briefing.com note: These actions were reported by multiple wire services oin the past 30 minutes)

17:04

MOSY MoSys announces COO Resigns From co (5.50 +0.01)

Co announced that Mehdi Bathaee resigned from the Co as an employee and chief operating officer on December 3, 2007. Bathaee joined the Co in August 2007 in connection with its acquisition of mixed signal integrated circuit designs and related assets from Atmel Corp and a corporation controlled by Bathaee, who continued to manage the acquired business and then was additionally appointed chief operating officer on October 1, 2007. Pending a complete review of the Co's operations and organizational structure, the Co's new CEO, Len Perham, will assume all of the responsibilities that had been delegated to the chief operating officer, and the Co's vice president of engineering, Hem Hingarh, temporarily will oversee the mixed signal design domestic and foreign engineering operations.

17:03

EDS EDS authorizes repurchase up to $1 bln of common stock over next 18 months (20.10 -0.08) -Update-

17:01

SONC Sonic management is comfortable with the market's current mean estimate for Q1 EPS $0.21 (34.00 -1.07)

Co announces continued sales momentum for the Q1 of 2008. Despite a slow start in the month of September, estimated same-store sales were within the co's tgt range of 2-4% for partner drive-ins and near the lower end of the target range for the system. Additionally, SONC's retrofit initiative remains on track with the completion of 240 retrofits system-wide, including 202 franchise retrofits during the quarter. Because of the continued strength of SONC's sales, mgmt is comfortable with the market's current mean estimate for Q1 EPS $0.21.

17:00

EDS Ron Rittenmeyer elected EDS Chairman of the Board (19.89 -0.08)

16:55

CPRT Copart beats by $0.03, beats on revs (37.02 -0.07)

Reports Q1 (Oct) earnings of $0.41 per share, $0.03 better than the First Call consensus of $0.38; revenues rose 39.3% year/year to $184 mln vs the $173.3 mln consensus.

16:50

UXG US Gold announces Bill Pass, Vice President and CFO, is retiring as of March 31, 2008 (2.83 -0.31)

16:44

CPST Capstone Turbine: New York City Mayor Bloomberg announces new rule for microturbine deployment (1.15 +0.01)

Co announced that New York City has implemented the country's first standard for the use and installation of microturbine technology. "Mayor Bloomberg's announcement yesterday of the new rule outlining the use and installation of microturbine systems in residential and commercial buildings in New York is an important milestone for Capstone as we look to help New York lower its greenhouse gas emissions and allow building owners to generate a portion of their own electricity throughout the five boroughs."

16:35

AFCE AFC Enterprises announces increase in share repurchase program by an additional $50 mln (10.77 -0.43)

16:33

AKS AK Steel announces January 2008 surcharges for electrical and stainless steels (45.15 +0.38)

Co has advised its customers that a $230 per ton surcharge will be added to invoices for electrical steel products shipped in January 2008.

16:31

GOL GOL announces traffic statistics for November 2007 (25.64 -0.66)

GOL Linhas Aereas Inteligentes S.A., the parent co of Brazil's low-cost airlines, GOL Transportes Aereos S.A. ("GTA", that operates the GOL brand) and VRG Linhas Aereas S.A. ("VRG", that operates the VARIG brand), today released preliminary passenger statistics for the month of November 2007. Consolidated domestic passenger traffic (RPK) for November 2007 increased 48% and capacity (ASK) increased 44% year-over-year. Domestic consolidated load factor for the month was 69%, and in the international market consolidated load factor was 53%. GOL's total consolidated load factor for the month of November was 66%. Average fares decreased 4% versus November 2006.

16:31

CHP C&D Tech promotes Leonard Kiely to Chief Operating Officer (4.91 -0.18)

16:31

CSCO Cisco Systems appoints Padmasree Warrior as Chief Technology Officer (26.96 -0.61)

Co announced the appointment of Padmasree Warrior as chief technology officer. Warrior comes to Cisco from Motorola (MOT), where she was executive vice president and chief technology officer. As CTO, Warrior will play a key leadership role in the continued development and communication of Cisco's technology strategy and vision. Warrior will work closely with Cisco's management team and chief development officer to drive innovation and explore new business and technology directions. Warrior will report to Cisco's chairman and chief executive officer, John Chambers.

16:21

BECN Beacon Roofing Supply President bought 56K shares at $8.75-9.20 on 11/30-12/04 (8.99 +0.12)

16:21

WUWestern Union increases stock buyback authorization by $1 bln (22.93 -0.19)

16:21

DNB Dun & Bradstreet updates Y08 guidance; announces acquisition (90.17 +0.29)

NVGN Novogen's Investigational Drug for Inflammatory Bowel Disease Has Positive Results Following Phase Ib Trial (6.08 )

Co announces that a recently completed Phase Ib clinical trial of a new drug to treat inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) indicates that treatment may be possible with just a single daily dose. The drug, NV-52, is a novel compound being developed by Novogen, as an oral agent for the maintenance of remission in IBD. There is no cure for IBD, and currently available medications are unable to prevent disease "flares." Following this once daily dosing regime, concentrations of NV-52 were maintained in the plasma of the volunteers at the level associated with suppression of colitis in the mouse model of IBD. This suggests that if the drug can be demonstrated to be effective in humans, only once daily dosing of NV-52 would be required to enable control of symptoms in IBD patients. Importantly, there were no adverse events and no side effects reported during the study.

HRB H & R Block announces mutual agreement to terminate sale of Option One Mortgage Corporation to Cerberus Capital (19.48 )

Co announced that it has agreed to terminate the purchase agreement entered into in April 2007 under which an affiliate of Cerberus Capital Management would have acquired Option One Mortgage Corporation ("OOMC"), a wholly owned subsidiary of H&R Block. Throughout recent months, the co and Cerberus worked to identify mutually acceptable alternatives for restructuring the April Agreement in light of the widespread changes in mortgage market conditions and the substantial reduction in new lending by OOMC. These discussions did not lead to a mutually acceptable agreement, and the co and Cerberus have agreed to terminate the April Agreement. Under the termination agreement each party will bear its own costs in connection with the proposed transaction, and the parties exchanged mutual releases. All negotiations between the parties have been concluded in a fully amicable manner. As previously disclosed, OOMC had previously substantially curtailed its new lending activities. The co announced today that it will close all remaining origination activities of OOMC. To this end, the co has already halted the acceptance of any new loan applications. "The co is determined to complete our exit from subprime mortgage lending without further delay, and today's action largely completes that objective. The mortgage market today has undergone vast changes since last April when the original Cerberus deal was signed. Despite the hard work and good faith of both sides we could not find a way to restructure the original transaction to mutual satisfaction. The termination agreement frees H&R Block to halt OOMC's remaining origination activities without incurring additional operating costs. At the same time, we will continue to pursue the ultimate sale of our servicing activities." The closure of mortgage origination activity will result in eliminating approximately 620 staff positions, closing three offices, and taking a pretax restructuring charge of approximately $75 mln. The bulk of the co's servicing activities are carried out with respect to loans owned by third parties. The co has retained the investment banking firm of Lazard to advise the co in connection with the ultimate sale of its servicing activities.

This amount excludes any charges for severance and other one restructuring costs.

18:56

DII Decorator Industries announces the acquisition of Doris Lee Draperies (4.20 -0.03)

Co announced it has acquired certain assets of Doris Lee Draperies ("Doris Lee") for ~$825,000 fortifying its position as the leading drapery and interior furnishing supplier to the manufactured housing industry. The acquisition closed on November 30, 2007. The assets included inventory, accounts receivable and office furniture and equipment. Additional payments for the business may be made over the next five years depending on the sales to Doris Lee's existing customers.

18:50

CAL Continental Airlines reports November 2007 operational performance (27.27 -0.88)

Co reported a November consolidated (mainline plus regional) load factor of 80.1%, 0.6 points below the November 2006 consolidated load factor, and a mainline load factor of 80.4%, 0.7 points below the November 2006 mainline load factor. In addition, the carrier reported a domestic mainline load factor of 83.1%, 1.1 points below November 2006, and an international mainline load factor of 77.3%, 0.1 points below November 2006.

18:06

HBIO Harvard Biosci divests the majority of its capital equipment business (3.95 -0.29)

Co announced it has completed the sale of its Genomic Solutions Division and its Belgian subsidiary, Maia Scientific, both part of its Capital Equipment Business Segment, to Digilab, Inc. The purchase price payable by Digilab under the terms of the Asset Purchase Agreement consists of $1,000,000 in cash plus additional consideration in the form of an earn-out based on 20% of the revenue generated by the acquired business as it is conducted by Digilab over a three-year period post-transaction.

18:03

WRNC Warnaco enters into exclusivity agreement regarding the sale of its Lejaby business (37.62 +0.72)

In connection with its previously announced intention to explore strategic alternatives for its Lejaby intimate apparel and related swimwear business, WRNC announced it has entered into an exclusivity agreement with Palmers Textil AG, a market leader for lingerie and intimate apparel products in Austria and Germany. Pursuant to the agreement, Warnaco has granted Palmers and its shareholders the exclusive right to conduct negotiations related to the sale of the Lejaby business. Negotiations of definitive documentation are proceeding; however, there can be no assurance that an agreement can be reached or that definitive documentation will be executed. Should the transaction proceed, Palmers has informed Warnaco that it currently intends to continue to operate Lejaby out of its headquarters in Lyon, France.

17:45

CBKN Capital Bank appoints Michael Moore Chief Financial Officer (13.20 +0.16)

Co announced that Michael Moore has been appointed as chief financial officer. Moore is a 27- year veteran of the banking industry with extensive experience in community and retail banking.

17:26

TK Teekay Corporation: Teekay Tankers Ltd. Files for Initial Public Offering of (54.15 -2.01)

Co announced that its wholly owned subsidiary, Teekay Tankers Ltd., has filed a registration statement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for an initial public offering of its Class A Common Stock. The offering currently is scheduled to include 10,000,000 shares of Class A Common Stock (11,500,000 shares if the underwriters exercise their over-allotment option in full), representing a 40% ownership interest. The Class A Common Stock has been approved for listing on The New York Stock Exchange, subject to official notice of issuance, under the symbol "TNK".

17:21

SCHS School Specialty board approves new share repurchase program (35.46 -0.23)

Co announced that its Board of Directors approved a new share repurchase authorization that gives the co the ability to purchase up to $50 mln of its issued and outstanding common stock. The authorization follows the co completing its prior program, which authorized the repurchase of $45 mln of School Specialty shares. Since that program was announced June 5, 2007, the co repurchased 1,254,681 shares of its common stock for an aggregate purchase price of $44.9 mln. Since the beginning of FY07, the co has repurchased 3,380,802 shares for a net purchase price of $121.4 mln.

17:14

MDU MDU Resources sees FY07 EPS in-line with consensus; co sees FY08 EPS below consenses (27.11 -0.18)

Co sees FY07 EPS of $1.65-1.75, excluding a $91.5 mln gain, vs $1.74 First Call consensus. Co sees FY08 EPS of $1.65-1.90 vs $1.94 First Call consensus. Co says, "MDU has sold our domestic independent power production assets recording the gain of $91.5 mln and doubled our natural gas utility customer base through the acquisition of Cascade Natural Gas. Our construction services group increased earnings by 45% through September over the prior year comparable period, and we made five acquisitions in our construction materials segment... Looking forward to 2008, we expect continued cyclicality in the construction materials business related to private markets, our fundamentals are strong. As we have experienced in the past, these types of cycles tend to be offset by improvements in our other core businesses. We expect to increase our natural gas and oil production and reserves as well as our natural gas pipeline throughput in 2008 and expect to continue growing our aggregate reserves. In addition, we have an excellent work backlog in our construction services group. Also, our utility group expects to add ~20 megawatts of wind-powered electric generation later this year and to realize the full-year effects of the Cascade Natural Gas acquisition in 2008."

17:09

FPB Fountain Powerboats to repurchase up to $900,000 of the co's stock common stock (1.25 -0.10)

17:07

STKL SunOpta announces secondary share offering (14.26 -0.05)

Co and The Charles R. Bronfman Trust (collectively, the "Selling Shareholders") of all of their 5,080,532 common shares of SunOpta. The Co confirmed that it will not receive any proceeds from the offering and that it has entered into an underwriting agreement at the request of the Selling Shareholders. The sole underwriter for this offering is BMO Capital Markets Corp.

17:07

CKH SEACOR announces increase in securities repurchase authority (90.97 -0.40)

Co announced that its Board of Directors has increased its authorization for repurchases of CKH's common stock and its 2.875% convertible senior debentures due 2024 by $115.5 mln for a total authorized expenditure of up to $150 mln for the purchase of such securities. In addition, CKH may purchase, separate from such authorization, any or all of its 7.2% senior notes due 2009, its 5 7/8% senior notes due 2012, and the 9 1/2% senior notes due 2013 of Seabulk International, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary.

17:03

SLW Silver Wheaton: Goldcorp updates Penasquito and Luismin silver production ests (15.35 +0.38)

The co announces that it has been advised by Goldcorp that the silver production estimates for both the Penasquito Project and Luismin's San Dimas operations have been recently updated as part of Goldcorp's annual budgeting process. Average annual silver production attributable to Silver Wheaton is expected to approximate 7.8 mln ounces, a 44% increase compared with the 2006 feasibility study. Life-of-mine silver production attributable to Silver Wheaton has increased to 140 mln ounces, representing a 52% increase over the June 2006 Feasibility Study levels. Silver production at the Penasquito Project attributable to Silver Wheaton is now expected to approximate 560,000 ounces, 2,600,000 ounces, 5.1 mln ounces and 6 mln ounces, respectively, in 2008, 2009, 2010 and 2011. The production increase at Luismin's San Dimas operations in Mexico, originally scheduled for 2009, has now been deferred to 2010. Expected production levels at San Dimas are now expected to be 7 mln ounces in 2008, 8 mln ounces in 2009, increasing to 12 mln ounces in 2010 and thereafter. This compares to previous guidance of 7 mln ounces in 2008 increasing to 13 mln ounces in 2009 and thereafter.

17:00

UAUA United Airlines reports November traffic results (39.81 -1.13)

Co reported its preliminary traffic results for November 2007. The co reported a November passenger load factor of 79.6%. Total scheduled revenue passenger miles (RPMs) decreased in November by 1.4% on a capacity decrease of 1.3% in scheduled available seat miles (ASMs) compared with the same period in 2006.

16:56

WPZ Williams Partners announces equity offering of 9.25 mln shares (40.30 -0.88)

The co announces today that it intends to commence underwritten public offering of 9,250,000 common units representing limited partner interests. The offering will be made pursuant to an effective shelf registration statement on Form S-3 previously filed with the SEC.

16:56

NG NovaGold Resources and Barrick finalize settlement transactions (9.51 -0.32)

NovaGold Resources (NG) and Barrick Gold (ABX) announce that the various transactions outlined in their joint press release of Nov 8, 2007 have been completed. All of the outstanding lawsuits between the cos and their respective affiliates are being dismissed, the Grace claims adjacent to Galore Creek have been transferred to the Galore Creek Mining Corporation (owned by a 50/50 partnership between NVG and Teck Cominco Limited) for a purchase price of $54C mln, and the restructuring of the Donlin Creek joint venture has been completed. NVG and ABX have formed a new limited liability co, jointly owned by NVG and ABX on a 50/50 basis, that will oversee development of the Donlin Creek project. The Donlin Creek L.L.C. will initially have a board of four directors, with two nominees selected by each co. All significant decisions related to Donlin Creek will require the approval of both NVG and ABX. NVG and ABX will each assign management and technical staff to support the project as it advances through the permitting process.

16:54

MF MF Global: Receiver Ad Litem and MF Global settle Philadelphia alternative asset fund litigation (27.48 -1.35)

The co announces Steven Harmelin, the Receiver ad litem, and MF Global have reached an agreement to settle litigation against MF Global, brought by the Receiver ad litem for Philadelphia Alternative Asset Fund and related entities, subject only to United States District Court approval. The settlement agreement obligates MF Global to pay $69 mln into a restoration fund for the benefit of investors in PAAF. The company will also pay $6 mln in legal fees and expenses.

16:54

NWEC Northwestern announces buyout of leased interest of approximately 143 MW of Colstrip Unit 4; accretive to earnings (27.81 -0.04)

Co has completed the purchase from SGE, a subsidiary of General Electric Capital Corporation, of SGE's Owner Participant interest representing approximately 143 MW of the co's 222 MW leased interest in the 740 MW Colstrip Unit 4 coal-fired steam electric generation unit located near Colstrip, Mont. The purchase price was approximately $133.4 mln, or approximately $933/Kw. NorthWestern paid $100.2 mln in cash and will consolidate $33.2 mln in outstanding lease debt. The outstanding lease debt will be fully amortized by the end of 2010. NorthWestern funded the transaction with available liquidity; and a newly formed subsidiary, Colstrip Lease Holdings LLC, is currently finalizing a $100 mln non-recourse loan to support this purchase. The loan is expected to close in the next 30 days. Accretion to earnings is expected to be approximately $.6 mln in 2008, $1.8 mln in 2009, $3.6 mln in 2010 and $4.8 mln thereafter.

16:41

PH Parker-Hannifin acquires Texas Thermowell Business of Bravura (78.78 -0.65)

The co announces that it has acquired the Texas Thermowell Industries business of Bravura, a leader in temperature sensing protection equipment. Parker purchased the Texas Thermowell business for an undisclosed amount. The anticipated annual revenue of the business for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2007 will be approximately $5 mln. The acquisition is expected to be accretive in its first full year of integration within Parker's Instrumentation Group and will be reported in Parker's Industrial North America Segment.

16:37

SMTC Semtech announces completion of accelerated stock buyback and resumption of existing stock repurchase program (15.13 -0.13)

The co announces that it completed on December 3, 2007 an accelerated stock repurchase program previously announced on May 30, 2007. The repurchase was funded with the co's existing cash, and the co intends to hold the repurchased shares as treasury stock. With the completion of the accelerated stock repurchase program, the co also announced today that it intends to resume purchasing shares of its common stock under its existing stock repurchase program, under which approximately $50.3 mln of remaining authority exists.

16:34

BRC Brady announces departure of CFO David Mathieson (38.43 -1.60)

Brady President and CEO Frank Jaehnert will assume the additional duties of CFO until a successor is named.

16:32

RRR RSC Holdings appoints David Mathieson as the new CFO and Senior Vice President (12.20 -0.08)

16:31

RCII Rent-A-Center announces store consolidation plan; cash outlay to be approx $26-$30.5 mln (14.08 -0.08)

Co announces plans to close approx 280 stores across the U.S. The co expects to incur pre-tax restructuring charges related to the store consolidation plan and other restructuring items in the range of $36 mln to $43 mln, substantially all of which will be recorded in Q4 of their fiscal year ending Dec 31, 2007. The co expects the cash outlay associated with this restructuring will be in the range of $26 mln to $30.5 mln over the next 12 to 18 months. The 280 stores identified generated revenues of approx $140 mln year-to-date through Oct 31, 2007. These stores will transfer their customer rental purchase agreements to existing Rent-A-Center stores and the co expects to retain the majority of these rental purchase agreements. At the conclusion of the restructuring, the co expects a pre-tax monthly operating income benefit in the range of $2 mln to $2.5 mln.

16:30

ASI American Safety Insurance board of directors authorizes stock repurchase program of up to 5k shares (19.07 +0.69)

16:23

TAM TAM and Lufthansa sign contract to begin shared flights between Brazil and Germany (28.12 -0.20)

The co announces -- TAM and Lufthansa signed a contract on Saturday, December 1, to start an operational code-sharing agreement on national and international routes. TAM and Lufthansa's flight partnership is expected to begin during the first half of 2008. Starting in February, clients of both companies will be able to accumulate and exchange points earned on TAM's Programa Fidelidade loyalty program and miles with Lufthansa's Miles & More program on flights operated by either co.

16:18

MER Merrill Lynch names Nelson Chai as Chief Financial Officer (59.06 -0.88)

Co announces that Nelson Chai has been appointed executive vice president and chief financial officer of the company, effective December 10, 2007. Mr. Chai has been executive vice president and chief financial officer of NYSE Euronext (NYX) and its predecessor company NYSE Group, Inc., since January 2006 and was chief financial officer of Archipelago Holdings from 2000 to 2005.

16:16

KBR KBR Awarded Engineering contract by Petrobras America (39.67 -0.15) -Update-

Co announced that its wholly-owned subsidiary, Granherne, has been awarded a three-year engineering services contract by Petrobras America, a subsidiary of Petrobras (PBR/PBRA).

16:15

CNI Canadian Natl Rail announces plan to buy back, through private agreements, up to five mln common shares under current 33-mln share repurchase program (48.20 -0.84) -Update-

Co announced that it intends to purchase for cancellation up to five million of its common shares outstanding, or ~1% of its common share outstanding at Nov. 30, 2007, pursuant to private agreements between CNI and an arm's-length third-party seller.

16:12

IVZ InVesco announces co moves primary listing to NYSE from LSE (27.23 +0.98) -Update-

16:09

SD SandRidge Energy reports Q3 EPS of $0.11, revs of $153.6 mln (31.20 -0.55)

Reports Q3 (Sept) earnings of $0.11 per share a 137% increase YoY. Total revenue increased 71% to $153.6 mln for the three months ended September 30, 2007 from $89.7 mln in the same period in 2006. This increase was due to a $94.9 mln increase in natural gas and oil sales and was partially offset by lower revs in their drilling and oil field services, midstream gas services, and other segments.

16:06

CPWM Cost Plus beats by $0.14, beats on revs; guides Q4 EPS below consensus, revs below consensus (3.16 +0.01)

Reports Q3 (Oct) loss of $0.63 per share, $0.14 better than the First Call consensus of ($0.77); revenues rose 2.4% year/year to $220.6 mln vs the $216.8 mln consensus. Co issues downside guidance for Q4, sees EPS of $0.37-0.50 vs. $0.51 consensus; sees Q4 revs of $377-389 mln vs. $390.28 mln consensus.

16:06

HOLX The co announces public offering of $1.3 bln of convertible senior notes (64.80 -1.59)

The co announces its intention to offer to sell, subject to market and other conditions, $1.3 bln aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2037 pursuant to an effective shelf registration statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The Company expects to grant to the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional $195 million aggregate principal amount of notes to cover overallotments.

16:03

TMO Thermo Fisher selected by China Doping Control Center to supply testing instrumentation for the 2008 Olympic games in Beijing (57.30 -0.34)

Co announces that the China Doping Control Center has selected the co as one of its major suppliers of instrumentation and software for the testing of athletes at the 29th Olympic Games in Beijing.

16:02

VICR Vicor announces changes in its finance department; CFO to VP of Tresury Services (14.13 -0.31)

Co announced that Mark Glazer, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary has transitioned to the position of Vice President of Treasury Services. In his new role, Mr. Glazer will focus on the development of the co's business units to facilitate achievement of the financial goals and objectives of each unit. The co will begin a search for a new Chief Financial Officer and structure its finance organization to best service the needs of each unit.

16:01

BMRN Biomarin Pharm and IGAN Biosciences to collaborate on development of an enzyme therapy to Treat IgA Nephropathy (27.35 -0.15) -Update-

Co and IGAN Biosciences announce that they have initiated a program to develop an IgA protease for treating IgA nephropathy.

16:00

CYTK Cytokinetics announces an abstract summarizing interim clinical trial data evaluating SB-743921 is scheduled to be presented as a poster presentation to be held December 8-11, 2007 (5.17 +0.31) -Update-

Co announces that an abstract summarizing interim clinical trial data evaluating SB-743921 is scheduled to be presented as a poster presentation at the 2007 Annual Meeting of the American Society of Hematology to be held Dec 8-11, 2007 at the Georgia World Congress Center in Atlanta, Georgia... The following abstract is scheduled to be presented at ASH as follows: Abstract #2556: A Phase I-II Study to Determine the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Potential Efficacy of the Kinesin Spindle Protein Inhibitor SB-743921 on Days 1 and 15 of a 28 Day Schedule in Patients with Non-Hodgkin's or Hodgkin's Lymphoma.

Hourly In Play (R)

Updated: 23-Oct-07 23:00 ET

19:01

CME CME Group and the Brazilian Mercantile & Futures Exchange agree to cross-equity stakes and exclusive order routing deal (634.60 +15.90) -Update-

Co and the Brazilian Mercantile & Futures Exchange S.A. (BM&F), the world's fourth largest derivatives exchange and the largest derivatives exchange in Latin America, announced that they have signed a non-binding letter of intent covering a proposed cross-investment between them. Under the arrangement, CME Group will acquire an equity stake of ~10%in BM&F in exchange for an equity stake of approxima~ 2% in CME Group. The transaction is expected to be completed following the close of BM&F's initial public offering, which is expected to occur this year.

VHI Valhi announces radioactive byproduct license decision (24.7 +1.55)

Co that its wholly owned subsidiary, Waste Control Specialists LLC ("WCS"), received notification that the Executive Director of the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality ("TCEQ") has prepared a draft license and made a preliminary decision that this license meets all statutory and regulatory requirements for the disposal of byproduct material at WCS' site in Andrews County, Texas. Byproduct material includes uranium or thorium mill tailings as well as equipment, pipe and other materials used to handle and process the mill tailings.

GHS GateHouse Media to acquire publications from Morris for $115 mln (11.25 -0.15)

Co announced that it has signed a definitive asset purchase agreement to acquire several daily and non-daily publications from Morris Publishing Group for a purchase price of $115 mln. The transaction is expected to close before the end of November and is subject to regulatory approval and customary closing conditions.

BRP Brasil Telecom announces gross revenue of R$ 4.0 bln and EBITDA of R$ 970.1 mln in 3Q07 (73.90 +0.81)

Co registered consolidated EBITDA of R$970.1 mln in 3Q07, 6.8% higher than in 3Q06. Consolidated EBITDA margin stood at 35.3%. Consolidated net revenue reached R$2,748.3 million, 4.6% higher than in 3Q06, and net income amounted to R$150.3 million, 134.7% up on 3Q06. Mobile telephony EBITDA totaled R$34.0 million in 3Q07, an increase of R$54.3 million over the same period the previous year, while the EBITDA margin came to 7.6%, 13.3 p.p. higher than in 3Q06.

FMP Feldman Mall Properties announces modest delay in reporting Q2 2007 financial results (5.17 -0.05)

Co reported that it is in the final stages of completing the release of its Q2 2007 financial results and plans to release earnings for Q2 within the next few days. Following the release of Q2 earnings, the Company will schedule a conference call to discuss Q2 results.

17:51

SWC Stillwater Mining releases 2007 Q3 production results; heavily affected by the labor issues there early in the quarter. (10.81 +0.36)

Co releases preliminary third quarter and year-to-date production results for its two operating mines and volumes processed in its platinum-group metal recycling activities. As anticipated, the results indicate that third quarter production at the Stillwater Mine was heavily affected by the labor issues there early in the quarter. Mine production for the third quarter and first nine months of 2007 overall was weaker than in the corresponding periods of 2006, particularly at the Stillwater Mine. Issues affecting third quarter 2007 output included a seven-day strike and associated labor disruption during July, and lower average productivity as the percentage of new miners in the workforce has increased. In addition to these third-quarter issues, the nine-month year-to-date results during 2007 also have included challenges with the performance of some new LHD equipment and lower productivity at the Stillwater Mine during the labor negotiations that led up to the strike. East Boulder Mine production during the quarter, which was unaffected by the labor issues, increased slightly from the year earlier results.

RJET Republic Airways misses by $0.01, misses on revs (20.44 -0.01)

Reports Q3 (Sep) earnings of $0.49 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.01 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $0.50; revenues rose 7.8% year/year to $330.1 mln vs the $353.4 mln consensus. The co expects to take delivery of 7 new E175s in the fourth quarter of 2007 and 27 new E175s during 2008. Additionally, 3 new E175s are scheduled for delivery in the first quarter of 2009. The co has firm financing commitments in place for 28 of its 37 remaining firm aircraft at competitive interest rates. The co expects to obtain competitive financing commitments on its remaining firm aircraft.

17:45

NOVN Noven Pharma: FDA issues approvable letter for Stavzor delayed release Valproic acid capsules (14.17 +0.10)

"The FDA states in the letter that it has completed its review of the Stavzor NDA and that it is approvable. The FDA has requested certain non-clinical information, including additional in vitro dissolution data, as a condition to final approval. The FDA has not requested additional human studies or clinical data. Because the NDA for Stavzor, submitted under Section 505(b)(2) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, references Abbott Laboratories' Depakote product, final approval is also subject to the expiration of any applicable exclusivity periods benefiting Depakote. Based on receipt of the approvable letter, interaction with Banner Pharmacaps (the NDA holder and developer of the product), and its understanding of Depakote exclusivity, Noven continues to expect Stavzor final approval, at the latest, by the end of July 2008. We are now working with Banner to satisfy the conditions to final approval as expeditiously as possible. Banner has advised that it expects to respond to the FDA's requests in the coming weeks. Concurrently, the Noven/JDS team has begun launch and production planning in anticipation of a 2008 launch of Stavzor."

Co launched and priced $500 mln of long 5-year and $1 bln of 10-year SEC registered securities. The bonds were issued by Diageo Capital plc, with payment of principal and interest fully guaranteed by Diageo plc. Due on 30 January 2013, the long 5-year issue pays a coupon of 5.20%. Due on 23 October 2017, the 10-year issue pays a coupon of 5.75%. Citi, Banc of America Securities LLC and Morgan Stanley were joint book-running managers. RBS Greenwich Capital and HSBC were co-managers. Proceeds from this issuance will be used for general corporate purposes.

Co says, "We expect that our Q4 results will be negatively impacted by three trends: 1) we expect to see further compression in our net interest margin as a result of the Fed rate cut; 2) the premiums received on SBA loan sales are declining due to investor expectation of faster prepayment speeds; and 3) deposit growth will continue to be challenging. On the positive side, we expect that these trends will be offset by continued strong loan production and solid asset quality."

"The September quarter proved more challenging than anticipated. Sales to the communications and industrial markets were below expectations, although consumer market segment sales were up strongly. With the Stratix III FPGA family now shipping, we are the only programmable logic company with 65-nm devices optimized for low power, which gives us a unique competitive position at the leading edge of FPGA deployment.
